subject: Economics
title: The Resource Curse: When Wealth Makes You Poor
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Resource Curse: When Wealth Makes You Poor usable.

hook.text: Nigeria has earned $600 billion from oil since 1960. Yet 40% of its population lives in extreme poverty.

buildup.text: The resource curse: countries rich in oil, diamonds, or minerals often have slower growth, more corruption.

discovery.text: Easy resource revenue reduces the pressure to build institutions, diversify the economy.

twist.text: Norway escaped the curse with a sovereign wealth fund that saves oil revenue for future generations. It now holds $1.

climax.text: Resources aren't inherently cursed â€” bad institutions are. The same oil that impoverished Nigeria enriched Norway.

punchline.text: Oil doesn't curse nations. Bad governance does.

quiz.question: How did Norway avoid the 'resource curse'?
options: It created a sovereign wealth fund to save oil revenue and invest it for future generations
